result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas R Mayer

records.addlTxt: Def's bond refund returned. Not deliverable as addressed. Remailed to updated address.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with CE except for in writing regarding child visitation.
- Defendant shall not be at CE's residence at W8863 US Hwy 12 in Fort Atkinson or anywhere she temporarily resides.
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Trial Judge - Br 12

8:35 AM Defendant Thomas R Mayer in court.  Attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day in court for Thomas R Mayer.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.
